title: Brook Already Reunited with Laboon During Timeskip
author: Various Reddit Users
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Brook had plenty of time during the two-year timeskip to return to Reverse Mountain and reunite with Laboon. Since Brook's dream was to see Laboon again, he may have already fulfilled this promise off-screen. This theory suggests that Brook may eventually sacrifice himself for the crew since he's already achieved his primary goal.

title: Laboon's Connection to One Piece Treasure Location
author: GameRant
theoryText: A theory suggests that Brook's story with Laboon hints at the location and nature of the One Piece treasure. Some fans claim the treasure is actually related to Joy Boy, and that a massive whale similar to Laboon exists under Long Ring Long Land, potentially hiding the One Piece. The theory connects the Rumbar Pirates' journey to the ultimate treasure.

title: Crocus's Past with Roger's Crew
author: One Piece Wiki Contributors
theoryText: When Crocus is first introduced in Episode 62, there are hints that he has a significant past. Fans theorized even from this early episode that Crocus had connections to Gold Roger's crew based on his age, knowledge, and the fact that he's positioned at the entrance to the Grand Line. This theory was later confirmed when it was revealed that Crocus served as the doctor on Roger's ship.

title: Laboon Will Play a Role in the Final War
author: Various Fans
theoryText: Due to Laboon's massive size and significance to the story, some fans theorize that Laboon will play an important role in the final war or the series climax. The theory suggests that when the Straw Hats complete their journey around the Grand Line and return to where they started, Laboon could assist them in a major battle, or that Laboon's reunion with Brook will be a pivotal emotional moment in the series finale.

title: The Rumbar Pirates' True Fate Foreshadowing
author: One Piece Analysts
theoryText: From Episode 62, fans began theorizing about what really happened to the Rumbar Pirates. Crocus mentions they've been gone for 50 years, but doesn't explain their fate. Early theories suggested they died from disease, were killed by enemies, or got trapped somewhere in the Grand Line. The introduction of Laboon's story made fans expect that the Rumbar Pirates' fate would be a tragic reveal that would connect to a future Straw Hat member.
